page.title: 13The Miners' Strike Doncaster
page.content:
The first question I asked was{"Did {you go on the picket lines?"}Andrew answered{"Yes I did but I didn't use {violence - it just made things worse." Then I asked{"Did you and your family {ever get free food or clothing?}He said{"No, not clothes, but we did get {a free food voucher for three pounds {to spend at the supermarket. And you {could also get a free large sack of {potatoes from the Miners' Institute {Centre."}
I helped them with sacking the potatoes and looking after them on a night. It earned us a little bit of extra money. It had a great effect on our family because we all became closer and helped each other more, but now the strike is over the family has drifted apart a bit again. { }
